results.title: Seven years in Tibet
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Annaud, Iain Smith, John H. Williams, Applecross Productions and Reperage and Vanguard Films
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Austrian climber Heinrich Harrer, this is the amazing true story of his friendship with the Dalai Lama. Climbing in the Himalayas, Harrer is captured as a POW in China at the start of the second world war. He manages to escape the camp and flees across the mountains into isolated Tibet. As one of the few foreigners to ever enter Tibet, Harrer forms a friendship with the young Dalai Lama and becomes his confidante. The film depicts the most tumultuous period of Tibetan history in which China invades and occupies Tibet - an oppression which continues to this day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean-Jacques Annaud, Iain Smith, John H. Williams, Applecross Productions and Reperage and Vanguard Films

results.title: Visual perception and failure to learn
results.creator_credit: Charles M. Wurst, Columbia Pictures Corporation and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the effects of different visual perceptual disabilities upon the performance and behaviour of children in a regular classroom and in a centre for remedial education.

results.title: Seven Samurai = Shichinin no samurai [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Shojiro Motoki and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: In 16th century Japan a primitive village, dreading the annual raid of bandits who carry off the harvest and the village girls, decides to hire Samurai to help defend themselves. With his help, six others are recruited. Overcoming the villagers’ fears, the Samurai begin to organise their defence. After a long period of waiting, the bandits attack. A series of violent battles follows, which ends at last in victory for the Samurai and the villagers. Hailed as one of the greatest films ever made, “Seven Samurai” was the second Kurosawa film to bring him great acclaim in the West (the first being “Rashomon”); Kurosawa presents peerless battle scenes, but he also encapsulates the humanity of the villagers’, their plight and the honour of the fearsome Samurais. Stars Toshiro Mifune and Takashi Shimura. Also available on VHS [301009].

results.title: Wm Bligh
results.creator_credit: John Croyston, Alan Burke, ABC and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behind the Legend”.
Presents a dramatized re-enactment of the events surrounding the arrest of Governor William Bligh by the New South Wales Corps in 1808. Various witnesses present their accounts of cowardice and misappropriation by Bligh. Introduced by Manning Clark and written by Thomas Keneally. Cast includes Brian James as Bligh, Peter Gwynne, Richard Meikle, Kevin Leslie, John Trenaman, Robyn Nevin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Croyston, Alan Burke, ABC and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Seven little Australians: Eps. 4-6
results.creator_credit: Ron Way, Charles Russell, Ethel Turner Productions and ABC
results.brief_description: The story of the Woolcot family, living in Sydney in the 1890’s. An Englishman in the New South Wales Regiment, Captain Woolcot is constantly harassed and embarrassed by the antics of his seven mischievous children: Meg, Pip, Judy, Nell, Bunty, Baby and ‘The General’. Episode 4: All for the worst: Bunty is plagued by the lies he tells, Meg makes efforts to be ‘grown up’ and Judy makes a tortuous trip home. Episode 5: Secrets: Judy arrives home worn out and ill, but makes the other children promise not to let Esther or the Captain know for fear of being sent back to school. Episode 6: Tomorrow do thy worst: Judy is still ill and the children try to take care of her. However, the Captain’s suspicions are aroused and he discovers Judy’s hiding place.

results.title: F.H. Greenway
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behind the Legend”.
Introduced by Manning Clarke, the film proficiently reconstructs the story of Francis Greenway’s relationship and court case with Edward Sanderson of the N.S.W. Corps, and gives glimpses of the conditions in the colony under the Governorship of Macquarie. Written by Joanne Bean, the cast includes John Ewart as Francis Greenway and Nick Tate as Captain Sanderson.

results.title: R. O'Hara Burke
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behind the Legend”.
Presents a dramatized reenactment of the events surrounding Robert O’Hara Burke through the memories of his friends. Aspects of his life, the Burke and Wills Expedition and his death are reconstructed. Introduced by Manning Clark and written by Thomas Keneally. Cast includes Tony Allyn as Burke, Cornelia Frances, Ian Nimmo, Richard Lupina, Don Philps, David Williams, Clive Marshall and Shirley Sunners.

results.title: Wolf pack
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Bill Brind and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A nature film that shows the absorbing, even admirable qualities of the wolf’s character and behavior, and its essential role in the natural scheme of life and death. Filmed by Bill Mason in caribou country, Wolf Pack closely observes the wolves through late winter into early spring. What emerges is a portrait of the wolf as a disciplined hunter, a respected leader, and a parent whose care for the young ensures the survival of the pack.

results.title: Wolf [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Andrew Duval, Bin Li, Janet Hines and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A woman living somewhere in the Australian high plains tends to her horses and gardens while something out of sight lurks. The woman has fantasies about a stranger who she desires to be with but also fears to be with and the line between fantasy and reality merge as she encounters the stranger in her house. This is a beautifully filmed short film that echoes the tale of “Little Red Riding Hood”. (Awards: Winner, Silver Award for Cinematography in a Short Film, NSW Australian Cinematographers Society Awards, Sydney, 1998)
